title: Sampler, 1814
medium:
Medium: cotton and silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: cross, double-cross, eyelet and queen embroidery stitches on foundation of plain weave with paired warps and wefts
inscribed: Inscription: "Mary A. Fox's Sampler Done in the Year 1814."
provenance: Ex. coll. Fraser-Martin. American Art Gallery cat. #383, 1921.
creditline: Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection
description: Square sampler worked in green, red, and black on a natural ground. Family record arranged in two columns listing dates of birth from 1722- 1831.  Three alphabets at the top and an inscription at the bottom: "Mary A. Fox's Sampler Done in the Year 1814."

exhibitions.title: Hella Jongerius Selects: Works from the Permanent Collection

tombstone.epitaph:
Sampler, 1814.
1814. Medium: cotton and silk embroidery on linen foundation
Technique: cross, double-cross, eyelet and queen embroidery stitches on foundation of plain weave with paired warps and wefts. Gift of Anonymous Donor from the Fraser/Martin Collection. 1974-100-5.
